title: Appetizer Recipes from Around the World
description: Take a trip around the world with popular appetizers from different countries. Add a few new dishes to your repertoire this year!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Take a Trip Around the World Through 13 Tasty Appetizers By Samantha Lande Updated on May 18, 2021 Close Credits: Melissa Goff Take a trip around the world with popular appetizers from different countries. Add a few new dishes to your repertoire this year! Appetizers are a great way to sample food from around the world. Pick three or four and make a meal of it. From samosas to coxinha, spanakopita to bruschetta, here are some of our favorite appetizers from around the world. 01 of 14 Greece: Spanakopita triangles angelily Spanakopita — phyllo dough stuffed with spinach, onions and feta — make a perfect Greek entrée, but turn them into triangles for an appetizer that will be gone in minutes. The filling comes together pretty simply but phyllo dough can be fickle (especially when folding it into triangles) so take your time. Spanakopita II 02 of 14 Brazil: Coxinha Allrecipes These chicken croquettes are a crowd pleaser for both adults and kids. The deep-fried dough is stuffed with shredded chicken, and in this version olives, onions, and parsley. The shape is made to resemble a chicken leg. Coxinhas (Brazilian Chicken Croquettes) 03 of 14 Puerto Rico: Tostones Melissa Goff Plantains are a big part of Puerto Rican cooking and this simple appetizer is just slicing and frying them. They are great as an appetizer or even a side dish and take less than 30 minutes to make. Puerto Rican Tostones (Fried Plantains) 04 of 14 Spain: Gambas al ajilo Chef John In Spain small plates, or tapas, are super popular. This dish — gamabas al ajilo — is a garlic shrimp dish made with lots of garlic, hot smoked paprika, and sherry. Chef John recommends having all of the ingredients prepped and ready to go as this dish comes together quickly. Spanish Garlic Shrimp (Gambas al Ajillo) 05 of 14 China: Pot-Stickers Photo by Meredith. Dumplings are fun to eat and prolific across menus in China. This recipe requires overnight prep time so make sure you leave enough time to chill the filling. Once the filling is ready, the dish comes together quickly with a frying and boiling method. Make a dipping sauce of chili oil, soy sauce and rice vinegar. Pot Stickers Traditional 06 of 14 Philippines: Lumpia Kim's Cooking Now Similar to an egg roll, lumpia are thin wrappers filled with a flavorful filling, usually pork and vegetables, and then deep fried. Serve immediately after draining on paper towels. Traditional Filipino Lumpia 07 of 14 Italy: Bruschetta House of Aqua Bruschetta is a super simple appetizer to whip up, but it's always a crowd pleaser. Using good ingredients —fresh basil, a high quality balsamic — will really amplify the flavors. This recipe calls for both sun-dried and Roma tomatoes. Double Tomato Bruschetta 08 of 14 Mexico: Guacamole Chef Mo Guacamole has become such a popular appetizer in America but it originated in Mexico. It's easy to customize as desired. Amp up your spice level or add in some mango for a sweet and spicy avocado dip. Guacamole Recipes 09 of 14 Peru: Ceviche Allrecipes Like guacamole, there are many ways to prepare ceviche — a flavorful raw fish dish, "cooked" in citrus that is popular in Latin American countries. This one is made with shrimp and amped up with hot sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and ketchup. Avocado Shrimp Ceviche-Estillo Sarita 10 of 14 India: Samosas lili Indian food can be full of new and interesting spices and samosas are the perfect introduction. This version is stuffed with beef, potatoes, and peas but there are many vegetarian versions as well. Beef Samosas 11 of 14 Vietnam: Spring Rolls gielastic Different than lumpia or egg rolls, Vietnamese spring rolls are wrapped in rice paper and aren't fried, making them refreshing and healthy. Stuff them with shrimp, a ton of fresh herbs. This recipe also includes two dipping sauces. Vietnamese Fresh Spring Rolls 12 of 14 Israel: Cheese Bourekas Photo by sugarplum. Often served for breakfast, these bourekas also make a great appetizer and introduction to Israeli food beyond just falafel and hummus. These puff pastries are stuffed with cheese and baked for 30 minutes until golden. Cheese Bourekas 13 of 14 China: Prawn Toast Chinese Prawn Toast. lutzflcat "These toasts are a popular and savory Chinese appetizer that's so very quick and easy to make," says lutzflcat. "They're perfect for just about any occasion." You'll spread a flavorful prawn mousse over crustless slices of sandwich bread and then fry the toasts to golden brown. Chinese Prawn Toast 14 of 14 More Recipes from World Cuisines Photo by Chef John. Complete Menus from Chef John That Celebrate World Cuisines A Taste Tour of Italy in 7 Complete Menus Explore more: Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Was this page helpful? Thanks for your feedback! Tell us why!
